CSS Workshop Grid - display: grid, 1fr 1fr 1fr, min-content, max-content, fit-content.
We create a grid by using the grid value of the display property.
Column tracks are defined with grid-template-columns and rows with grid-template-rows.
The gap property is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.
The explicit grid is the grid defined by grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows.
Items placed, or filling tracks due to auto-placement outside of that grid form the implicit grid.
Tracks on the implicit grid are auto sized, however you can control them with grid-auto-columns and grid-auto-rows.

Advanced CSS Layout
Affordances
Define which elements are block level and which are inline by default.
Block level goes down the page.
Inline level goes across the page.
Display can be changed: Inline can be block and block can be inline.
Flex and Grid have an outer containers and inner contents
Control the inner contents spacing with the justify and align properties.

The justify-content property accepts five different values:  flex-start (default): items are packed toward the start line  flex-end: items are packed toward to end line  center: items are centered along the line  space-between: items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item on the end line  space-around: items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them  space-evenly: items are distributed so that the spacing between any two adjacent alignment subjects, before the first alignment subject, and after the last alignment subject is the same

Mobile UI Design - Include the Five Affordances
+ Portability: Users can take the device anywhere and use it on the go. Hence, affordances must be glanceable.
+ Context Sensitivity: The device can sense the user’s context such as location, orientation, lighting levels, and more. Make affordances sensitive.  Adapt to context requirements and constraints.
+ Social Interactivity: Users can communicate and interact with other users. Social affordances should facilitate better cooperation, communication, and collaboration.
+ Connectivity: Mobile devices can be used with and without internet and network connectivity. Affordances should respect offline or low-bandwidth scenarios.
+ Individuality: Devices are personal. This makes it possible to design personalized and customized experiences.

Critical Thinking: De Bono: Pattern recognition, Perspective, Brainstorming, Lateral Thinking, Reflection, and Reasoning.

1. Pattern recognition: Identifying patterns, relationships, and connections between ideas and concepts. 2. Perspective taking: Understanding different viewpoints and considering alternative perspectives. 3. Brainstorming: Generating a large number of ideas within a short period of time without worrying about their feasibility or practicality. 4. Lateral thinking: Exploring unconventional and innovative solutions to challenges. 5. Reflection: Evaluating and analyzing one's own thoughts, beliefs, and behaviors to gain insight and self-awareness. 6. Reasoning: Drawing logical conclusions based on evidence and reasoning.

Cambridge University: Motion Prepositions
A study on motion prepositions identified six different types commonly used in language to express spatial relationships and movement.

These types include:  "To" and "from" prepositions indicating directional movement, like "to," "from," "into," and "out of." "Through" prepositions, such as "through" and "across," used to signify movement within or across a defined space. "Over" and "under" prepositions, denoting relative height or position. "Around" prepositions, illustrating movement in a circular or surrounding manner. "Along" prepositions, portraying movement in parallel or contiguous directions. "Beyond" and "behind" prepositions, conveying movement in relation to a particular point or object.
Parametric curves used in computer graphics: Linear, Quadratic, Cubic, Quartic, Quintic, and Sextic.

MENU AND NAV LISTS:   The <menu> list is overlooked. Its purpose is to style button groups that offer functions that are NOT links. For example, in an email app, you'd have buttons for reply, forward, delete, etc. These buttons would be marked up using <menu>.  Contrast this with standard <nav> navigation bars containing <ul> unordered lists. Navbars take you to another page via an <a> link. Buttons with <button>, however, are for JavaScript programming and anything else that's not a link.

Dark mode needs to be improved. It needs to transform bright colors and white objects on the page to a dim color set. The brightness of everything on the page can make it impossible to focus on the info being displayed. Consider the content being presented on a screen from a presenter. If the viewer has set their system to a dark mode, the presentation on youtube is still too bright. This change of anything over a set brightness level needs to be driven automatically by artificial intelligence.
